page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: Our rectangle is fairly near to the coast.It has a recently built main road running through the middle. Towards the west of the rectangle there is a small village called Tal-y-Bont with a railway line next to it.Penrhyn Castle is an historic building owned by the National Trust. It is situated in the North West of the rectangle. There are a few farms and all of them are rented out by the Penrhyn Estate.The Penrhyn slate railway (which closed down a few years back) used to run through the South West of our rectangle.It took slate from Penrhyn Quarry to Port Penrhyn docks to be shipped to America.
